newsitem.title: UK: FTSE 100 ends lower, but holds above 3,900 level.
newsitem.headline: FTSE 100 ends lower, but holds above 3,900 level.

text.p: Losses in British bank and oil shares, plus weakness in gilts, kept a lid on the FTSE 100 index of leading British shares on Tuesday.

But the index managed to hold the closely-watched 3,900 level, closing 1.8 lower at 3,905.7 points. Dividend payouts skimmed 1.6 points off the FTSE 100, with ASDA Group, BSkyB, Railtrack and Reed International all ex-dividend.
Advancers on the FTSE 100 narrowly outnumbered decliners 51 to 45. And volume was relatively light, with only 478 million shares registered by 1539 GMT.
